ch.epfl.lis.wingj.structure.tools

Class KiteSnake

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.epfl.lis.wingj.structure.tools.KiteSnake
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    big.ij.snake2D.Snake2D

    public class KiteSnake
extends java.lang.Object
implements big.ij.snake2D.Snake2D
    Implements an active contour method (snake) to identify fluorescence features with cross-like shape.

    The snake is parameterized by 5 points: the kite center, and 4 external points that define the exterior contour of the kite.

    The energy is composed of two terms: the image energy, that leads the central cross of the kite towards regions in the image with high pixel values; and the regularization energy that prevents the external kite points to move far away of a region around the kite center.

    Version:
    March 5, 2013
    Author:
    Ricard Delgado-Gonzalo (ricard.delg...@gmail.com), Thomas Schaffter (thomas.schaff...@gmail.com)

      • setNodes

        public void setNodes(big.ij.snake2D.Snake2DNode[] inNode)
        This method provides a mutator to the snake-defining nodes.

        It will be called repeatedly by the methods Snake2DKeeper.interact() and Snake2DKeeper.optimize(). These calls are unconditional and may happen whether the method isAlive() returns true or false.

        Specified by:
        setNodes in interface big.ij.snake2D.Snake2D

      • isCanceledByUser

        public boolean isCanceledByUser()
        If true, indicates that the user chose to interactively abort the processing of the snake.

        Otherwise, if false, indicates that the dealings with the snake were terminated without user assistance.
